hobble.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to walk with difficulty, especially because your legs or feet hurt
hobble.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He hobbled into the room on crutches.
hobble.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to deliberately make sure that a plan, system etc cannot work successfully
hobble.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Many start-ups are hobbled by a lack of sufficient capital.
hobble.translation[0].definitions[1].not: Hobble is usually passive in this meaning
hobble.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to loosely fasten two of an animalâ€™s legs together, to stop it from running away
